message:
I write useful (by me) plugin for vim. Autocomplete, code checking and more. No need install python libs.
See screencast (sorry for quality, my first video): http://t.co/3b0bzeXA
And download: https://github.com/klen/python-mode
@horneds: Today my textmate trial expires. I was going to switch back to vim, and this looks like it could seal the deal. I'll have to give it a shot later. Thanks for sharing.
If you were liking textmate you ought to check out sublime text 2.
I use also a different color scheme (like Zenburn, http://programmers.stackexchange.com/questions/66997/what-is-your-favorite-colorscheme-for-programming-in-vim)
I'm in like 3:21 (pylint integration and I'm sold). What's the color scheme?
I've been using ropevim - http://rope.sourceforge.net/ropevim.html - with great results. It seems to do all of the same things?
I cant work with python-mode in vim version 7.3.35 :(

When you issue the command `:version`, do you see "+python" in the output? 
If not, your vim was not compiled with Python support.
